DestinationType.documentation: The type of publishing destination. Currently, only Amazon S3 buckets are supported.

Status.documentation: The status of the publishing destination.

PublishingFailureStartTimestamp.documentation: The time, in epoch millisecond format, at which GuardDuty was first unable to publish findings to the destination.

DestinationProperties.documentation: A DestinationProperties object that includes the DestinationArn and KmsKeyArn of the publishing destination.

DestinationId.documentation: The unique ID of the publishing destination.

DestinationType.documentation: The type of resource used for the publishing destination. Currently, only Amazon S3 buckets are supported.

Status.documentation: The status of the publishing destination.

Destination.documentation: Contains information about the publishing destination, including the ID, type, and status.

DestinationArn.documentation:
The ARN of the resource to publish to.

To specify an S3 bucket folder use the following format: arn:aws:s3:::DOC-EXAMPLE-BUCKET/myFolder/

KmsKeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key to use for encryption.

DestinationProperties.documentation: Contains the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to publish to, such as an S3 bucket, and the ARN of the KMS key to use to encrypt published findings.

Anomaly.documentation: The details about the anomalous activity that caused GuardDuty to generate the finding.

Name.documentation: Name of the additional configuration.

Status.documentation: Status of the additional configuration.

DetectorAdditionalConfiguration.documentation: Information about the additional configuration for a feature in your GuardDuty account.

Name.documentation: Name of the additional configuration.

Status.documentation: Status of the additional configuration.

UpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which the additional configuration was last updated. This is in UTC format.

Name.documentation: The name of the feature.

Status.documentation: The status of the feature.

DetectorFeatureConfiguration.documentation:
Contains information about a GuardDuty feature.

Specifying both EKS Runtime Monitoring (EKS_RUNTIME_MONITORING) and Runtime Monitoring (RUNTIME_MONITORING) will cause an error. You can add only one of these two features because Runtime Monitoring already includes the threat detection for Amazon EKS resources. For more information, see Runtime Monitoring.

Name.documentation: Indicates the name of the feature that can be enabled for the detector.

Status.documentation: Indicates the status of the feature that is enabled for the detector.

UpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which the feature object was updated.

DetectorFeatureConfigurationResult.documentation:
Contains information about a GuardDuty feature.

Specifying both EKS Runtime Monitoring (EKS_RUNTIME_MONITORING) and Runtime Monitoring (RUNTIME_MONITORING) will cause an error. You can add only one of these two features because Runtime Monitoring already includes the threat detection for Amazon EKS resources. For more information, see Runtime Monitoring.

AdminAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Account ID for the organizations account to be disabled as a GuardDuty delegated administrator.

DetectorId.documentation: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.
The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.

DisassociateFromMasterAccountRequest.deprecatedMessage: This input is deprecated, use DisassociateFromAdministratorAccountRequest instead

DisassociateFromMasterAccountResponse.deprecatedMessage: This output is deprecated, use DisassociateFromAdministratorAccountResponse instead

DetectorId.documentation: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account whose members you want to disassociate from the administrator account.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to disassociate from the administrator account.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of objects that contain the unprocessed account and a result string that explains why it was unprocessed.

Domain.documentation: The domain information for the DNS query.

Protocol.documentation: The network connection protocol observed in the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate the finding.

Blocked.documentation: Indicates whether the targeted port is blocked.

DomainWithSuffix.documentation: The second and top level domain involved in the activity that potentially prompted GuardDuty to generate this finding. For a list of top-level and second-level domains, see public suffix list.

VpcOwnerAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the VPC through which the DNS request was made.

DnsRequestAction.documentation: Contains information about the DNS_REQUEST action described in this finding.

Domain.documentation: The domain information for the Amazon Web Services API call.

ScannedVolumeDetails.documentation: List of EBS volumes that were scanned.

SkippedVolumeDetails.documentation: List of EBS volumes that were skipped from the malware scan.

EbsVolumeDetails.documentation: Contains list of scanned and skipped EBS volumes with details.

ScanId.documentation: Unique Id of the malware scan that generated the finding.

ScanStartedAt.documentation: Returns the start date and time of the malware scan.

ScanCompletedAt.documentation: Returns the completion date and time of the malware scan.

TriggerFindingId.documentation: GuardDuty finding ID that triggered a malware scan.

Sources.documentation: Contains list of threat intelligence sources used to detect threats.

ScanDetections.documentation: Contains a complete view providing malware scan result details.

ScanType.documentation: Specifies the scan type that invoked the malware scan.

EbsVolumeScanDetails.documentation: Contains details from the malware scan that created a finding.

Status.documentation: Describes whether scanning EBS volumes is enabled as a data source.

Reason.documentation: Specifies the reason why scanning EBS volumes (Malware Protection) was not enabled as a data source.

EbsVolumesResult.documentation: Describes the configuration of scanning EBS volumes as a data source.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The availability zone of the Amazon EC2 instance. For more information, see Availability zones in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

ImageDescription.documentation: The image description of the Amazon EC2 instance.

InstanceState.documentation: The state of the Amazon EC2 instance. For more information, see Amazon EC2 instance state changes in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

OutpostArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Outpost. This shows applicable Amazon Web Services Outposts instances.

Platform.documentation: The platform of the Amazon EC2 instance.

ProductCodes.documentation: The product code of the Amazon EC2 instance.

Ec2Instance.documentation: Details about the potentially impacted Amazon EC2 instance resource.

Ipv6Addresses.documentation: A list of IPv6 addresses for the Amazon EC2 instance.

PrivateIpAddresses.documentation: Other private IP address information of the Amazon EC2 instance.

PublicIp.documentation: The public IP address of the Amazon EC2 instance.

SecurityGroups.documentation: The security groups associated with the Amazon EC2 instance.

SubNetId.documentation: The subnet ID of the Amazon EC2 instance.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC ID of the Amazon EC2 instance.

Ec2NetworkInterface.documentation: Contains information about the elastic network interface of the Amazon EC2 instance.

Name.documentation: The name of the ECS Cluster.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the cluster.

Status.documentation: The status of the ECS cluster.

ActiveServicesCount.documentation: The number of services that are running on the cluster in an ACTIVE state.

RegisteredContainerInstancesCount.documentation: The number of container instances registered into the cluster.

RunningTasksCount.documentation: The number of tasks in the cluster that are in the RUNNING state.

Tags.documentation: The tags of the ECS Cluster.

TaskDetails.documentation: Contains information about the details of the ECS Task.

EcsClusterDetails.documentation: Contains information about the details of the ECS Cluster.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.

DefinitionArn.documentation: The ARN of the task definition that creates the task.

TaskCreatedAt.documentation: The Unix timestamp for the time when the task was created.

StartedAt.documentation: The Unix timestamp for the time when the task started.

StartedBy.documentation: Contains the tag specified when a task is started.

Tags.documentation: The tags of the ECS Task.

Volumes.documentation: The list of data volume definitions for the task.

Containers.documentation: The containers that's associated with the task.

Group.documentation: The name of the task group that's associated with the task.

LaunchType.documentation: A capacity on which the task is running. For example, Fargate and EC2.

EcsTaskDetails.documentation: Contains information about the task in an ECS cluster.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the Amazon EKS cluster involved in the finding.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp indicating when the Amazon EKS cluster was created, in UTC format.

Status.documentation: The current status of the Amazon EKS cluster.

VpcId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) associated with the Amazon EKS cluster.

Ec2InstanceUids.documentation: A list of unique identifiers for the Amazon EC2 instances that serve as worker nodes in the Amazon EKS cluster.

EksCluster.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon EKS cluster involved in a GuardDuty finding, including cluster identification, status, and network configuration.

Name.documentation: EKS cluster name.

VpcId.documentation: The VPC ID to which the EKS cluster is attached.

Status.documentation: The EKS cluster status.

Tags.documentation: The EKS cluster tags.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the EKS cluster was created.

EksClusterDetails.documentation: Details about the EKS cluster involved in a Kubernetes finding.

AdminAccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID for the organization account to be enabled as a GuardDuty delegated administrator.

ThreatIntelligenceDetails.documentation: A list of threat intelligence details related to the evidence.

Evidence.documentation: Contains information about the reason that the finding was generated.

Issues.documentation: Runtime coverage issues identified for the resource running on Amazon Web Services Fargate.

ManagementType.documentation:
Indicates how the GuardDuty security agent is managed for this resource.

  • AUTO_MANAGED indicates that GuardDuty deploys and manages updates for this resource.

  • DISABLED indicates that the deployment of the GuardDuty security agent is disabled for this resource.

The MANUAL status doesn't apply to the Amazon Web Services Fargate (Amazon ECS only) woprkloads.

FargateDetails.documentation: Contains information about Amazon Web Services Fargate details associated with an Amazon ECS cluster.

EqualsValue.documentation: Represents an equal condition to be applied to a single field when querying for scan entries.

GreaterThan.documentation: Represents a greater than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for scan entries.

LessThan.documentation: Represents a less than condition to be applied to a single field when querying for scan entries.

FilterCriterion.documentation: Represents a condition that when matched will be added to the response of the operation.

FilterCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for describing scan entries.

CriterionKey.documentation: An enum value representing possible scan properties to match with given scan entries.

FilterCriterion.documentation: Represents a condition that when matched will be added to the response of the operation. Irrespective of using any filter criteria, an administrator account can view the scan entries for all of its member accounts. However, each member account can view the scan entries only for their own account.

AccountId.documentation: The ID of the account in which the finding was generated.

CreatedAt.documentation: The time and date when the finding was created.

Region.documentation: The Region where the finding was generated. For findings generated from Global Service Events, the Region value in the finding might differ from the Region where GuardDuty identifies the potential threat. For more information, see How GuardDuty handles Amazon Web Services CloudTrail global events in the Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.

SchemaVersion.documentation: The version of the schema used for the finding.

UpdatedAt.documentation: The time and date when the finding was last updated.

AssociatedAttackSequenceArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the attack sequence finding.

Finding.documentation: Contains information about the finding that is generated when abnormal or suspicious activity is detected.

Criterion.documentation: Represents a map of finding properties that match specified conditions and values when querying findings.

FindingCriteria.documentation: Contains information about the criteria used for querying findings.

CountBySeverity.documentation: Represents a list of map of severity to count statistics for a set of findings.
CountBySeverity.deprecatedMessage: This parameter is deprecated. Please set GroupBy to 'SEVERITY' to return GroupedBySeverity instead.

GroupedByAccount.documentation: Represents a list of map of accounts with a findings count associated with each account.

GroupedByDate.documentation: Represents a list of map of dates with a count of total findings generated on each date per severity level.

GroupedByFindingType.documentation:
Represents a list of map of finding types with a count of total findings generated for each type.

Based on the orderBy parameter, this request returns either the most occurring finding types or the least occurring finding types. If the orderBy parameter is ASC, this will represent the least occurring finding types in your account; otherwise, this will represent the most occurring finding types. The default value of orderBy is DESC.

GroupedByResource.documentation: Represents a list of map of top resources with a count of total findings.

GroupedBySeverity.documentation: Represents a list of map of total findings for each severity level.

LastGeneratedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which this finding type was last generated in your environment.

TotalFindings.documentation: The total number of findings associated with generated for each distinct finding type.

FindingTypeStatistics.documentation: Information about each finding type associated with the groupedByFindingType statistics.

Status.documentation: Denotes whether VPC flow logs is enabled as a data source.

FlowLogsConfigurationResult.documentation: Contains information on the status of VPC flow logs as a data source.

Name.documentation: The name of the feature for which the free trial is configured.

FreeTrialDaysRemaining.documentation: The number of the remaining free trial days for the feature.

FreeTrialFeatureConfigurationResult.documentation: Contains information about the free trial period for a feature.

Lat.documentation: The latitude information of the remote IP address.

Lon.documentation: The longitude information of the remote IP address.

GeoLocation.documentation: Contains information about the location of the remote IP address. By default, GuardDuty returns Geolocation with Lat and Lon as 0.0.

DetectorId.documentation: The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.

The unique ID of the GuardDuty detector.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

FilterCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria used to filter the coverage statistics.

StatisticsType.documentation: Represents the statistics type used to aggregate the coverage details.

CoverageStatistics.documentation: Represents the count aggregated by the statusCode and resourceType.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that you want to get.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp of when the detector was created.

Status.documentation: The detector status.

DataSources.documentation: Describes which data sources are enabled for the detector.
DataSources.deprecatedMessage: This parameter is deprecated, use Features instead

Tags.documentation: The tags of the detector resource.

Features.documentation: Describes the features that have been enabled for the detector.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that is associated with this filter.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

FilterName.documentation: The name of the filter you want to get.

Name.documentation: The name of the filter.

Action.documentation: Specifies the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

Rank.documentation: Specifies the position of the filter in the list of current filters. Also specifies the order in which this filter is applied to the findings.

FindingCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for querying findings.

Tags.documentation: The tags of the filter resource.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose findings you want to retrieve.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

FindingIds.documentation: The IDs of the findings that you want to retrieve.

SortCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria used for sorting findings.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector whose findings statistics you want to retrieve.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

FindingStatisticTypes.documentation: The types of finding statistics to retrieve.
FindingStatisticTypes.deprecatedMessage: This parameter is deprecated, please use GroupBy instead

FindingCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria that is used for querying findings.

GroupBy.documentation: Displays the findings statistics grouped by one of the listed valid values.

OrderBy.documentation:
Displays the sorted findings in the requested order. The default value of orderBy is DESC.

You can use this parameter only with the groupBy parameter.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results to be returned in the response. The default value is 25.

You can use this parameter only with the groupBy parameter.

NextToken.documentation:
The pagination parameter to be used on the next list operation to retrieve more items.

This parameter is currently not supported.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that is associated with the IPSet.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

IpSetId.documentation: The unique ID of the IPSet to retrieve.

Name.documentation: The user-friendly name for the IPSet.

Format.documentation: The format of the file that contains the IPSet.

Location.documentation: The URI of the file that contains the IPSet.

Status.documentation: The status of IPSet file that was uploaded.

Tags.documentation: The tags of the IPSet resource.

ExpectedBucketOwner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket specified in the location parameter. This field appears in the response only if it was provided during IPSet creation or update.

MalwareProtectionPlanId.documentation: A unique identifier associated with Malware Protection plan resource.

Arn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the protected resource.

Role.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that includes the permissions to scan and add tags to the associated protected resource.

ProtectedResource.documentation: Information about the protected resource that is associated with the created Malware Protection plan. Presently, S3Bucket is the only supported protected resource.

Actions.documentation: Information about whether the tags will be added to the S3 object after scanning.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the Malware Protection plan resource was created.

Status.documentation: Malware Protection plan status.

StatusReasons.documentation: Information about the issue code and message associated to the status of your Malware Protection plan.

Tags.documentation: Tags added to the Malware Protection plan resource.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that is associated with this scan.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ScanResourceCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for scanning resources.

EbsSnapshotPreservation.documentation: An enum value representing possible snapshot preservation settings.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

GetMasterAccountRequest.deprecatedMessage: This input is deprecated, use GetAdministratorAccountRequest instead

GetMasterAccountResponse.deprecatedMessage: This output is deprecated, use GetAdministratorAccountResponse instead

DetectorId.documentation:
The detector ID for the administrator account.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

MemberDataSourceConfigurations.documentation: An object that describes which data sources are enabled for a member account.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of member account IDs that were unable to be processed along with an explanation for why they were not processed.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account whose members you want to retrieve.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts that you want to describe.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of objects that contain the unprocessed account and a result string that explains why it was unprocessed.

OrganizationDetails.documentation: Information about the statistics report for your organization.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty member account.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of account identifiers of the GuardDuty member account.

Accounts.documentation: The member accounts which were included in a request and were processed successfully.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: The member account that was included in a request but for which the request could not be processed.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector associated with the threat entity set resource.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ThreatEntitySetId.documentation: The unique ID that helps GuardDuty identify the threat entity set.

Name.documentation: The name of the threat entity set associated with the specified threatEntitySetId.

Format.documentation: The format of the file that contains the threat entity set.

Location.documentation: The URI of the file that contains the threat entity set.

ExpectedBucketOwner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket specified in the location parameter.

Status.documentation: The status of the associated threat entity set.

Tags.documentation: The tags associated with the threat entity set resource.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the associated threat entity set was created.

UpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the associated threat entity set was updated.

ErrorDetails.documentation: The error details when the status is shown as ERROR.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that is associated with the threatIntelSet.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ThreatIntelSetId.documentation: The unique ID of the threatIntelSet that you want to get.

Name.documentation: A user-friendly ThreatIntelSet name displayed in all findings that are generated by activity that involves IP addresses included in this ThreatIntelSet.

Location.documentation: The URI of the file that contains the ThreatIntelSet.

Status.documentation: The status of threatIntelSet file uploaded.

Tags.documentation: The tags of the threat list resource.

ExpectedBucketOwner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket specified in the location parameter. This field appears in the response only if it was provided during ThreatIntelSet creation or update.

DetectorId.documentation: The unique ID of the GuardDuty detector associated with this trusted entity set.

TrustedEntitySetId.documentation: The unique ID that helps GuardDuty identify the trusted entity set.

Name.documentation: The name of the threat entity set associated with the specified trustedEntitySetId.

Format.documentation: The format of the file that contains the trusted entity set.

Location.documentation: The URI of the file that contains the trusted entity set.

ExpectedBucketOwner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket specified in the location parameter.

Status.documentation: The status of the associated trusted entity set.

Tags.documentation: The tags associated with trusted entity set resource.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the associated trusted entity set was created.

UpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the associated trusted entity set was updated.

ErrorDetails.documentation: The error details when the status is shown as ERROR.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service whose usage statistics you want to retrieve.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

UsageStatisticType.documentation: The type of usage statistics to retrieve.

UsageCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria used for querying usage.

Unit.documentation: The currency unit you would like to view your usage statistics in. Current valid values are USD.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation: A token to use for paginating results that are returned in the response. Set the value of this parameter to null for the first request to a list action. For subsequent calls, use the NextToken value returned from the previous request to continue listing results after the first page.

UsageStatistics.documentation: The usage statistics object. If a UsageStatisticType was provided, the objects representing other types will be null.

NextToken.documentation: The pagination parameter to be used on the next list operation to retrieve more items.

Severity.documentation: Severity level of the highest severity threat detected.

ThreatName.documentation: Threat name of the highest severity threat detected as part of the malware scan.

Count.documentation: Total number of infected files with the highest severity threat detected.

HighestSeverityThreatDetails.documentation: Contains details of the highest severity threat detected during scan and number of infected files.

Path.documentation: Path of the file or directory on the host that the volume maps to.

HostPath.documentation: Represents a pre-existing file or directory on the host machine that the volume maps to.

Arn.documentation: The profile ARN of the EC2 instance.

Id.documentation: The profile ID of the EC2 instance.

IamInstanceProfile.documentation: Contains information about the EC2 instance profile.

Username.documentation: Information about the username that was being impersonated.

Groups.documentation: The group to which the user name belongs.

Key.documentation: Specific indicator keys observed in the attack sequence. For description of the valid values for key, see Attack sequence finding details in the Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.

Values.documentation: Values associated with each indicator key. For example, if the indicator key is SUSPICIOUS_NETWORK, then the value will be the name of the network. If the indicator key is ATTACK_TACTIC, then the value will be one of the MITRE tactics.

Indicator.documentation: Contains information about the indicators that include a set of signals observed in an attack sequence.

AvailabilityZone.documentation: The Availability Zone of the EC2 instance.

IamInstanceProfile.documentation: The profile information of the EC2 instance.

ImageDescription.documentation: The image description of the EC2 instance.

ImageId.documentation: The image ID of the EC2 instance.

OutpostArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services Outpost. Only applicable to Amazon Web Services Outposts instances.

LaunchTime.documentation: The launch time of the EC2 instance.

NetworkInterfaces.documentation: The elastic network interface information of the EC2 instance.

ProductCodes.documentation: The product code of the EC2 instance.

Tags.documentation: The tags of the EC2 instance.

InstanceDetails.documentation: Contains information about the details of an instance.

AccountId.documentation: The ID of the account that the invitation was sent from.

InvitationId.documentation: The ID of the invitation. This value is used to validate the inviter account to the member account.

RelationshipStatus.documentation: The status of the relationship between the inviter and invitee accounts.

InvitedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the invitation was sent.

Invitation.documentation: Contains information about the invitation to become a member account.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty account with which you want to invite members.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of account IDs of the accounts that you want to invite to GuardDuty as members.

DisableEmailNotification.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether you want to disable email notification to the accounts that you are inviting to GuardDuty as members.

Message.documentation: The invitation message that you want to send to the accounts that you're inviting to GuardDuty as members.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of objects that contain the unprocessed account and a result string that explains why it was unprocessed.

NestedItemPath.documentation: The nested item path where the infected file was found.

Hash.documentation: The hash value of the infected resource.

ItemPath.documentation: Information about the nested item path and hash of the protected resource.

SourceIps.documentation: The IP of the Kubernetes API caller and the IPs of any proxies or load balancers between the caller and the API endpoint.

UserAgent.documentation: The user agent of the caller of the Kubernetes API.

StatusCode.documentation: The resulting HTTP response code of the Kubernetes API call action.

Parameters.documentation: Parameters related to the Kubernetes API call action.

Resource.documentation: The resource component in the Kubernetes API call action.

Subresource.documentation: The name of the sub-resource in the Kubernetes API call action.

Namespace.documentation: The name of the namespace where the Kubernetes API call action takes place.

ResourceName.documentation: The name of the resource in the Kubernetes API call action.

KubernetesApiCallAction.documentation: Information about the Kubernetes API call action described in this finding.

Enable.documentation: The status of Kubernetes audit logs as a data source.

KubernetesAuditLogsConfiguration.documentation: Describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are enabled as a data source.

Status.documentation: A value that describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are enabled as a data source.

KubernetesAuditLogsConfigurationResult.documentation: Describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are enabled as a data source.

AuditLogs.documentation: The status of Kubernetes audit logs as a data source.

KubernetesConfiguration.documentation: Describes whether any Kubernetes data sources are enabled.

AuditLogs.documentation: Describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are enabled as a data source.

KubernetesConfigurationResult.documentation: Describes whether any Kubernetes logs will be enabled as a data source.

AuditLogs.documentation: Describes whether Kubernetes audit logs are enabled as a data source.

KubernetesDataSourceFreeTrial.documentation: Provides details about the Kubernetes resources when it is enabled as a data source.

KubernetesUserDetails.documentation: Details about the Kubernetes user involved in a Kubernetes finding.

KubernetesWorkloadDetails.documentation: Details about the Kubernetes workload involved in a Kubernetes finding.

KubernetesDetails.documentation: Details about Kubernetes resources such as a Kubernetes user or workload resource involved in a Kubernetes finding.

Verb.documentation: The verb component of the Kubernetes API call. For example, when you check whether or not you have the permission to call the CreatePod API, the verb component will be Create.

Resource.documentation: The Kubernetes resource with which your Kubernetes API call will interact.

Namespace.documentation: The namespace where the Kubernetes API action will take place.

Allowed.documentation: Information whether the user has the permission to call the Kubernetes API.

KubernetesPermissionCheckedDetails.documentation: Information about the Kubernetes API for which you check if you have permission to call.

Kind.documentation: The kind of the role. For role binding, this value will be RoleBinding.

Name.documentation: The name of the RoleBinding.

Uid.documentation: The unique identifier of the role binding.

RoleRefName.documentation: The name of the role being referenced. This must match the name of the Role or ClusterRole that you want to bind to.

RoleRefKind.documentation: The type of the role being referenced. This could be either Role or ClusterRole.

KubernetesRoleBindingDetails.documentation: Contains information about the role binding that grants the permission defined in a Kubernetes role.

Kind.documentation: The kind of role. For this API, the value of kind will be Role.

Name.documentation: The name of the Kubernetes role.

Uid.documentation: The unique identifier of the Kubernetes role name.

KubernetesRoleDetails.documentation: Information about the Kubernetes role name and role type.

Username.documentation: The username of the user who called the Kubernetes API.

Uid.documentation: The user ID of the user who called the Kubernetes API.

Groups.documentation: The groups that include the user who called the Kubernetes API.

SessionName.documentation: Entity that assumes the IAM role when Kubernetes RBAC permissions are assigned to that role.

KubernetesUserDetails.documentation: Details about the Kubernetes user involved in a Kubernetes finding.

ContainerUids.documentation: A list of unique identifiers for the containers that are part of the Kubernetes workload.

Namespace.documentation: The Kubernetes namespace in which the workload is running, providing logical isolation within the cluster.

KubernetesResourcesTypes.documentation: The types of Kubernetes resources involved in the workload.

KubernetesWorkload.documentation: Contains information about Kubernetes workloads involved in a GuardDuty finding, including pods, deployments, and other Kubernetes resources.

Name.documentation: Kubernetes workload name.

Namespace.documentation: Kubernetes namespace that the workload is part of.

HostNetwork.documentation: Whether the hostNetwork flag is enabled for the pods included in the workload.

Containers.documentation: Containers running as part of the Kubernetes workload.

Name.documentation: The name of the additional configuration that will be configured for the organization. These values are applicable to only Runtime Monitoring protection plan.

AutoEnable.documentation:
The status of the additional configuration that will be configured for the organization. Use one of the following values to configure the feature status for the entire organization:

  • NEW: Indicates that when a new account joins the organization, they will have the additional configuration enabled automatically.

  • ALL: Indicates that all accounts in the organization have the additional configuration enabled automatically. This includes NEW accounts that join the organization and accounts that may have been suspended or removed from the organization in GuardDuty.

    It may take up to 24 hours to update the configuration for all the member accounts.

  • NONE: Indicates that the additional configuration will not be automatically enabled for any account in the organization. The administrator must manage the additional configuration for each account individually.

OrganizationAdditionalConfiguration.documentation:
A list of additional configurations which will be configured for the organization.

Additional configuration applies to only GuardDuty Runtime Monitoring protection plan.

AutoEnable.documentation:
Describes the status of the additional configuration that is configured for the member accounts within the organization. One of the following values is the status for the entire organization:

  • NEW: Indicates that when a new account joins the organization, they will have the additional configuration enabled automatically.

  • ALL: Indicates that all accounts in the organization have the additional configuration enabled automatically. This includes NEW accounts that join the organization and accounts that may have been suspended or removed from the organization in GuardDuty.

    It may take up to 24 hours to update the configuration for all the member accounts.

  • NONE: Indicates that the additional configuration will not be automatically enabled for any account in the organization. The administrator must manage the additional configuration for each account individually.

Database.documentation: The name of the database instance involved in the anomalous login attempt.

Ssl.documentation: The version of the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) used for the network.

AuthMethod.documentation: The authentication method used by the user involved in the finding.

RdsDbUserDetails.documentation: Contains information about the user and authentication details for a database instance involved in the finding.

DbShardGroupIdentifier.documentation: The name associated with the Limitless DB shard group.

DbShardGroupResourceId.documentation: The resource identifier of the DB shard group within the Limitless Database.

DbShardGroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the DB shard group.

Engine.documentation: The database engine of the database instance involved in the finding.

DbClusterIdentifier.documentation: The name of the database cluster that is a part of the Limitless Database.

Tags.documentation: Information about the tag key-value pair.

RdsLimitlessDbDetails.documentation: Contains information about the resource type RDSLimitlessDB that is involved in a GuardDuty finding.

LoginAttributes.documentation: Indicates the login attributes used in the login attempt.

RdsLoginAttemptAction.documentation: Indicates that a login attempt was made to the potentially compromised database from a remote IP address.

AccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the remote API caller.

Affiliated.documentation: Details on whether the Amazon Web Services account of the remote API caller is related to your GuardDuty environment. If this value is True the API caller is affiliated to your account in some way. If it is False the API caller is from outside your environment.

RemoteAccountDetails.documentation: Contains details about the remote Amazon Web Services account that made the API call.

City.documentation: The city information of the remote IP address.

Country.documentation: The country code of the remote IP address.

GeoLocation.documentation: The location information of the remote IP address.

IpAddressV4.documentation: The IPv4 remote address of the connection.

IpAddressV6.documentation: The IPv6 remote address of the connection.

Organization.documentation: The ISP organization information of the remote IP address.

RemoteIpDetails.documentation: Contains information about the remote IP address of the connection.

Port.documentation: The port number of the remote connection.

PortName.documentation: The port name of the remote connection.

AccessKeyDetails.documentation: The IAM access key details (user information) of a user that engaged in the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

InstanceDetails.documentation: The information about the EC2 instance associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

EksClusterDetails.documentation: Details about the EKS cluster involved in a Kubernetes finding.

KubernetesDetails.documentation: Details about the Kubernetes user and workload involved in a Kubernetes finding.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of Amazon Web Services resource.

EbsVolumeDetails.documentation: Contains list of scanned and skipped EBS volumes with details.

EcsClusterDetails.documentation: Contains information about the details of the ECS Cluster.

RdsDbInstanceDetails.documentation: Contains information about the database instance to which an anomalous login attempt was made.

RdsLimitlessDbDetails.documentation: Contains information about the RDS Limitless database that was involved in a GuardDuty finding.

RdsDbUserDetails.documentation: Contains information about the user details through which anomalous login attempt was made.

LambdaDetails.documentation: Contains information about the Lambda function that was involved in a finding.

Resource.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Web Services resource associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

S3Bucket.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon S3 bucket.

Ec2Instance.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon EC2 instance.

AccessKey.documentation: Contains information about the IAM access key details of a user that involved in the GuardDuty finding.

Ec2NetworkInterface.documentation: Contains information about the elastic network interface of the Amazon EC2 instance.

S3Object.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon S3 object.

EksCluster.documentation: Contains detailed information about the Amazon EKS cluster associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

KubernetesWorkload.documentation: Contains detailed information about the Kubernetes workload associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

Container.documentation: Contains detailed information about the container associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

ResourceData.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Web Services resource that is associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

InstanceArn.documentation: Instance ARN that was scanned in the scan entry.

ResourceDetails.documentation: Represents the resources that were scanned in the scan entry.

AccountId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account.

LastGeneratedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which the statistics for this resource was last generated.

ResourceId.documentation:
ID associated with each resource. The following list provides the mapping of the resource type and resource ID.

Mapping of resource and resource ID

  • AccessKey - resource.accessKeyDetails.accessKeyId

  • Container - resource.containerDetails.id

  • ECSCluster - resource.ecsClusterDetails.name

  • EKSCluster - resource.eksClusterDetails.name

  • Instance - resource.instanceDetails.instanceId

  • KubernetesCluster - resource.kubernetesDetails.kubernetesWorkloadDetails.name

  • Lambda - resource.lambdaDetails.functionName

  • RDSDBInstance - resource.rdsDbInstanceDetails.dbInstanceIdentifier

  • S3Bucket - resource.s3BucketDetails.name

  • S3Object - resource.s3BucketDetails.name

TotalFindings.documentation: The total number of findings associated with this resource.

ResourceStatistics.documentation: Information about each resource type associated with the groupedByResource statistics.

Name.documentation: The name of the resource.

AccountId.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID to which the resource belongs.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of the Amazon Web Services resource.

Region.documentation: The Amazon Web Services Region where the resource belongs.

Service.documentation: The Amazon Web Services service of the resource.

CloudPartition.documentation: The cloud partition within the Amazon Web Services Region to which the resource belongs.

Tags.documentation: Contains information about the tags associated with the resource.

Data.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Web Services resource associated with the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate a finding.

ResourceV2.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Web Services resource that is associated with the GuardDuty finding.

ModifyingProcess.documentation: Information about the process that modified the current process. This is available for multiple finding types.

ModifiedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which the process modified the current process. The timestamp is in UTC date string format.

ScriptPath.documentation: The path to the script that was executed.

LibraryPath.documentation: The path to the new library that was loaded.

LdPreloadValue.documentation: The value of the LD_PRELOAD environment variable.

SocketPath.documentation: The path to the docket socket that was accessed.

ReleaseAgentPath.documentation: The path in the container that modified the release agent file.

MountSource.documentation: The path on the host that is mounted by the container.

MountTarget.documentation: The path in the container that is mapped to the host directory.

Flags.documentation: Represents options that control the behavior of a runtime operation or action. For example, a filesystem mount operation may contain a read-only flag.

ModuleName.documentation: The name of the module loaded into the kernel.

ModuleFilePath.documentation: The path to the module loaded into the kernel.

ShellHistoryFilePath.documentation: The path to the modified shell history file.

TargetProcess.documentation: Information about the process that had its memory overwritten by the current process.

AddressFamily.documentation: Represents the communication protocol associated with the address. For example, the address family AF_INET is used for IP version of 4 protocol.

IanaProtocolNumber.documentation: Specifies a particular protocol within the address family. Usually there is a single protocol in address families. For example, the address family AF_INET only has the IP protocol.

MemoryRegions.documentation: Specifies the Region of a process's address space such as stack and heap.

ToolCategory.documentation: Category that the tool belongs to. Some of the examples are Backdoor Tool, Pentest Tool, Network Scanner, and Network Sniffer.

ServiceName.documentation: Name of the security service that has been potentially disabled.

CommandLineExample.documentation: Example of the command line involved in the suspicious activity.

ThreatFilePath.documentation: The suspicious file path for which the threat intelligence details were found.

RuntimeDetails.documentation: Information about the process and any required context values for a specific finding.

OwnerId.documentation: The owner ID of the associated S3Amazon S3bucket.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which the Amazon S3 bucket was created.

EncryptionType.documentation: The type of encryption used for the Amazon S3 buckets and its objects. For more information, see Protecting data with server-side encryption in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key that is used to encrypt the Amazon S3 bucket and its objects.

EffectivePermission.documentation: Describes the effective permissions on this S3 bucket, after factoring all the attached policies.

PublicReadAccess.documentation: Indicates whether or not the public read access is allowed for an Amazon S3 bucket.

PublicWriteAccess.documentation: Indicates whether or not the public write access is allowed for an Amazon S3 bucket.

AccountPublicAccess.documentation: Contains information about the public access policies that apply to the Amazon S3 bucket at the account level.

BucketPublicAccess.documentation: Contains information about public access policies that apply to the Amazon S3 bucket.

S3ObjectUids.documentation: Represents a list of Amazon S3 object identifiers.

S3Bucket.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon S3 bucket policies and encryption.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket.

Name.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket.

Type.documentation: Describes whether the bucket is a source or destination bucket.

CreatedAt.documentation: The date and time the bucket was created at.

Tags.documentation: All tags attached to the S3 bucket

DefaultServerSideEncryption.documentation: Describes the server side encryption method used in the S3 bucket.

PublicAccess.documentation: Describes the public access policies that apply to the S3 bucket.

S3ObjectDetails.documentation: Information about the S3 object that was scanned.

Enable.documentation: The status of S3 data event logs as a data source.

S3LogsConfiguration.documentation: Describes whether S3 data event logs will be enabled as a data source.

Status.documentation: A value that describes whether S3 data event logs are automatically enabled for new members of the organization.

S3LogsConfigurationResult.documentation: Describes whether S3 data event logs will be enabled as a data source.

ETag.documentation: The entity tag is a hash of the Amazon S3 object. The ETag reflects changes only to the contents of an object, and not its metadata.

Key.documentation: The key of the Amazon S3 object.

VersionId.documentation: The version Id of the Amazon S3 object.

S3Object.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon S3 object.

ObjectArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 object.

ETag.documentation: The entity tag is a hash of the S3 object. The ETag reflects changes only to the contents of an object, and not its metadata.

Hash.documentation: Hash of the threat detected in this finding.

S3ObjectDetail.documentation: Information about the S3 object that was scanned

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that is associated with the request.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AdminDetectorId.documentation:
The unique detector ID of the administrator account that the request is associated with. If the account is an administrator, the AdminDetectorId will be the same as the one used for DetectorId.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ScanId.documentation: The unique scan ID associated with a scan entry.

ScanStatus.documentation: An enum value representing possible scan statuses.

ScanStartTime.documentation: The timestamp of when the scan was triggered.

ScanEndTime.documentation: The timestamp of when the scan was finished.

TriggerDetails.documentation: Specifies the reason why the scan was initiated.

ResourceDetails.documentation: Represents the resources that were scanned in the scan entry.

AccountId.documentation: The ID for the account that belongs to the scan.

FileCount.documentation: Represents the number of files that were scanned.

AttachedVolumes.documentation: List of volumes that were attached to the original instance to be scanned.

ScanType.documentation: Specifies the scan type that invoked the malware scan.

Scan.documentation: Contains information about malware scans associated with GuardDuty Malware Protection for EC2.

MapEquals.documentation: Represents an mapEqual condition to be applied to a single field when triggering for malware scan.

Value.documentation: Represents optional value in the map condition. If not specified, only the key will be matched.

ScanConditionPair.documentation: Represents the key:value pair to be matched against given resource property.

ScanCriterion.documentation: Represents a map of resource properties that match specified conditions and values when triggering malware scans.

ScanCriterionKey.documentation: An enum value representing possible resource properties to match with given scan condition.

HighestSeverityThreatDetails.documentation: Details of the highest severity threat detected during malware scan and number of infected files.

ThreatDetectedByName.documentation: Contains details about identified threats organized by threat name.

ScanDetections.documentation: Contains a complete view providing malware scan result details.

EbsVolumes.documentation: Describes the configuration for scanning EBS volumes as data source.

ScanEc2InstanceWithFindings.documentation: Describes whether Malware Protection for EC2 instances with findings will be enabled as a data source.

EbsVolumes.documentation: Describes the configuration of scanning EBS volumes as a data source.

ScanEc2InstanceWithFindingsResult.documentation: An object that contains information on the status of whether Malware Protection for EC2 instances with findings will be enabled as a data source.

FilePath.documentation: The file path of the infected file.

VolumeArn.documentation: EBS volume ARN details of the infected file.

Hash.documentation: The hash value of the infected file.

ScanFilePath.documentation: Contains details of infected file including name, file path and hash.

Include.documentation: Represents condition that when matched will allow a malware scan for a certain resource.

Exclude.documentation: Represents condition that when matched will prevent a malware scan for a certain resource.

ScanResourceCriteria.documentation: Contains information about criteria used to filter resources before triggering malware scan.

ScanResult.documentation: An enum value representing possible scan results.

Name.documentation: The name of the identified threat.

Severity.documentation: Severity of threat identified as part of the malware scan.

ItemCount.documentation: Total number of files infected with given threat.

FilePaths.documentation: List of infected files in EBS volume with details.

ScanThreatName.documentation: Contains files infected with the given threat providing details of malware name and severity.

TotalGb.documentation: Total GB of files scanned for malware.

AllowPrivilegeEscalation.documentation: Whether or not a container or a Kubernetes pod is allowed to gain more privileges than its parent process.

GroupId.documentation: The security group ID of the EC2 instance.

GroupName.documentation: The security group name of the EC2 instance.

SecurityGroup.documentation: Contains information about the security groups associated with the EC2 instance.

Actors.documentation: Contains information about the actors involved in the attack sequence.

Resources.documentation: Contains information about the resources involved in the attack sequence.

Endpoints.documentation: Contains information about the network endpoints that were used in the attack sequence.

Signals.documentation: Contains information about the signals involved in the attack sequence.

SequenceIndicators.documentation: Contains information about the indicators observed in the attack sequence.

AdditionalSequenceTypes.documentation: Additional types of sequences that may be associated with the attack sequence finding, providing further context about the nature of the detected threat.

Sequence.documentation: Contains information about the GuardDuty attack sequence finding.

Action.documentation: Information about the activity that is described in a finding.

Evidence.documentation: An evidence object associated with the service.

Count.documentation: The total count of the occurrences of this finding type.

DetectorId.documentation: The detector ID for the GuardDuty service.

EventFirstSeen.documentation: The first-seen timestamp of the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate this finding.

EventLastSeen.documentation: The last-seen timestamp of the activity that prompted GuardDuty to generate this finding.

ResourceRole.documentation: The resource role information for this finding.

ServiceName.documentation: The name of the Amazon Web Services service (GuardDuty) that generated a finding.

UserFeedback.documentation: Feedback that was submitted about the finding.

AdditionalInfo.documentation: Contains additional information about the generated finding.

FeatureName.documentation: The name of the feature that generated a finding.

EbsVolumeScanDetails.documentation: Returns details from the malware scan that created a finding.

RuntimeDetails.documentation: Information about the process and any required context values for a specific finding

Detection.documentation: Contains information about the detected unusual behavior.

MalwareScanDetails.documentation: Returns details from the malware scan that generated a GuardDuty finding.

Service.documentation: Contains additional information about the generated finding.

Value.documentation: This field specifies the value of the additional information.

Type.documentation: Describes the type of the additional information.

MfaStatus.documentation:
Indicates whether or not multi-factor authencation (MFA) was used during authentication.

In Amazon Web Services CloudTrail, you can find this value as userIdentity.sessionContext.attributes.mfaAuthenticated.

CreatedTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the session was created.

In Amazon Web Services CloudTrail, you can find this value as userIdentity.sessionContext.attributes.creationDate.

Issuer.documentation:
Identifier of the session issuer.

In Amazon Web Services CloudTrail, you can find this value as userIdentity.sessionContext.sessionIssuer.arn.

LastGeneratedAt.documentation: The timestamp at which a finding type for a specific severity was last generated.

Severity.documentation: The severity level associated with each finding type.

TotalFindings.documentation: The total number of findings associated with this severity.

SeverityStatistics.documentation: Information about severity level for each finding type.

Type.documentation:
The type of the signal used to identify an attack sequence.

Signals can be GuardDuty findings or activities observed in data sources that GuardDuty monitors. For more information, see Foundational data sources in the Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.

A signal type can be one of the valid values listed in this API. Here are the related descriptions:

  • FINDING - Individually generated GuardDuty finding.

  • CLOUD_TRAIL - Activity observed from CloudTrail logs

  • S3_DATA_EVENTS - Activity observed from CloudTrail data events for S3. Activities associated with this type will show up only when you have enabled GuardDuty S3 Protection feature in your account. For more information about S3 Protection and steps to enable it, see S3 Protection in the Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.

Name.documentation: The name of the signal. For example, when signal type is FINDING, the signal name is the name of the finding.

CreatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the first finding or activity related to this signal was observed.

UpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when this signal was last observed.

FirstSeenAt.documentation: The timestamp when the first finding or activity related to this signal was observed.

LastSeenAt.documentation: The timestamp when the last finding or activity related to this signal was observed.

Severity.documentation: The severity associated with the signal. For more information about severity, see Findings severity levels in the Amazon GuardDuty User Guide.

Count.documentation: The number of times this signal was observed.

ResourceUids.documentation: Information about the unique identifiers of the resources involved in the signal.

ActorIds.documentation: Information about the IDs of the threat actors involved in the signal.

EndpointIds.documentation: Information about the endpoint IDs associated with this signal.

SignalIndicators.documentation: Contains information about the indicators associated with the signals.

Signal.documentation: Contains information about the signals involved in the attack sequence.

AttributeName.documentation: Represents the finding attribute, such as accountId, that sorts the findings.

OrderBy.documentation: The order by which the sorted findings are to be displayed.

SortCriteria.documentation: Contains information about the criteria used for sorting findings.

ResourceArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource for which you invoked the API.

ScanId.documentation: A unique identifier that gets generated when you invoke the API without any error. Each malware scan has a corresponding scan ID. Using this scan ID, you can monitor the status of your malware scan.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector of the GuardDuty administrator account associated with the member accounts to monitor.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of account IDs of the GuardDuty member accounts to start monitoring.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of objects that contain the unprocessed account and a result string that explains why it was unprocessed.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector associated with the GuardDuty administrator account that is monitoring member accounts.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of account IDs for the member accounts to stop monitoring.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of objects that contain an accountId for each account that could not be processed, and a result string that indicates why the account was not processed.

Key.documentation: Describes the key associated with the tag.

Value.documentation: Describes the value associated with the tag key.

Tag.documentation: Contains information about a tag key-value pair.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the GuardDuty resource to apply a tag to.

Tags.documentation: The tags to be added to a resource.

Name.documentation: Name of the detected threat that caused GuardDuty to generate this finding.

Source.documentation: Source of the threat that generated this finding.

ItemPaths.documentation: Information about the nested item path and hash of the protected resource.

Threat.documentation: Information about the detected threats associated with the generated finding.

UniqueThreatNameCount.documentation: Total number of unique threats by name identified, as part of the malware scan.

Shortened.documentation: Flag to determine if the finding contains every single infected file-path and/or every threat.

ThreatNames.documentation: List of identified threats with details, organized by threat name.

ThreatDetectedByName.documentation: Contains details about identified threats organized by threat name.

ThreatListName.documentation: The name of the threat intelligence list that triggered the finding.

ThreatNames.documentation: A list of names of the threats in the threat intelligence list that triggered the finding.

ThreatFileSha256.documentation: SHA256 of the file that generated the finding.

ThreatIntelligenceDetail.documentation: An instance of a threat intelligence detail that constitutes evidence for the finding.

Unit.documentation: The currency unit that the amount is given in.

Total.documentation: Contains the total usage with the corresponding currency unit for that value.

GuardDutyFindingId.documentation: The ID of the GuardDuty finding that triggered the malware scan.

TriggerDetails.documentation: Represents the reason the scan was triggered.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector associated with the findings to unarchive.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

FindingIds.documentation: The IDs of the findings to unarchive.

Result.documentation: A reason why the account hasn't been processed.

UnprocessedAccount.documentation: Contains information about the accounts that weren't processed.

UnprocessedDataSourcesResult.documentation: Specifies the names of the data sources that couldn't be enabled.

ResourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the resource to remove tags from.

TagKeys.documentation: The tag keys to remove from the resource.

The unique ID of the detector to update.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

Enable.documentation: Specifies whether the detector is enabled or not enabled.

FindingPublishingFrequency.documentation: An enum value that specifies how frequently findings are exported, such as to CloudWatch Events.

DataSources.documentation:
Describes which data sources will be updated.

There might be regional differences because some data sources might not be available in all the Amazon Web Services Regions where GuardDuty is presently supported. For more information, see Regions and endpoints.
DataSources.deprecatedMessage: This parameter is deprecated, use Features instead

Features.documentation: Provides the features that will be updated for the detector.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service where you want to update a filter.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

Description.documentation: The description of the filter. Valid characters include alphanumeric characters, and special characters such as hyphen, period, colon, underscore, parentheses ({ }, [ ], and ( )), forward slash, horizontal tab, vertical tab, newline, form feed, return, and whitespace.

Action.documentation: Specifies the action that is to be applied to the findings that match the filter.

Rank.documentation: Specifies the position of the filter in the list of current filters. Also specifies the order in which this filter is applied to the findings.

FindingCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for querying findings.

Name.documentation: The name of the filter.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector that is associated with the findings for which you want to update the feedback.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

FindingIds.documentation: The IDs of the findings that you want to mark as useful or not useful.

DetectorId.documentation:
The detectorID that specifies the GuardDuty service whose IPSet you want to update.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

IpSetId.documentation: The unique ID that specifies the IPSet that you want to update.

Name.documentation: The unique ID that specifies the IPSet that you want to update.

Location.documentation: The updated URI of the file that contains the IPSet.

Activate.documentation: The updated Boolean value that specifies whether the IPSet is active or not.

ExpectedBucketOwner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket specified in the location parameter.

MalwareProtectionPlanId.documentation: A unique identifier associated with the Malware Protection plan.

Role.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role with permissions to scan and add tags to the associated protected resource.

Actions.documentation: Information about whether the tags will be added to the S3 object after scanning.

ProtectedResource.documentation: Information about the protected resource that is associated with the created Malware Protection plan. Presently, S3Bucket is the only supported protected resource.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the detector that specifies the GuardDuty service where you want to update scan settings.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ScanResourceCriteria.documentation: Represents the criteria to be used in the filter for selecting resources to scan.

EbsSnapshotPreservation.documentation: An enum value representing possible snapshot preservation settings.

DetectorId.documentation:
The detector ID of the administrator account.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AccountIds.documentation: A list of member account IDs to be updated.

DataSources.documentation: Describes which data sources will be updated.
DataSources.deprecatedMessage: This parameter is deprecated, use Features instead

Features.documentation: A list of features that will be updated for the specified member accounts.

UnprocessedAccounts.documentation: A list of member account IDs that were unable to be processed along with an explanation for why they were not processed.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector that configures the delegated administrator.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

AutoEnable.documentation:
Represents whether to automatically enable member accounts in the organization. This applies to only new member accounts, not the existing member accounts. When a new account joins the organization, the chosen features will be enabled for them by default.

Even though this is still supported, we recommend using AutoEnableOrganizationMembers to achieve the similar results. You must provide a value for either autoEnableOrganizationMembers or autoEnable.
AutoEnable.deprecatedMessage: This field is deprecated, use AutoEnableOrganizationMembers instead

DataSources.documentation: Describes which data sources will be updated.
DataSources.deprecatedMessage: This parameter is deprecated, use Features instead

Features.documentation: A list of features that will be configured for the organization.

AutoEnableOrganizationMembers.documentation:
Indicates the auto-enablement configuration of GuardDuty for the member accounts in the organization. You must provide a value for either autoEnableOrganizationMembers or autoEnable.

Use one of the following configuration values for autoEnableOrganizationMembers:

  • NEW: Indicates that when a new account joins the organization, they will have GuardDuty enabled automatically.

  • ALL: Indicates that all accounts in the organization have GuardDuty enabled automatically. This includes NEW accounts that join the organization and accounts that may have been suspended or removed from the organization in GuardDuty.

    It may take up to 24 hours to update the configuration for all the member accounts.

  • NONE: Indicates that GuardDuty will not be automatically enabled for any account in the organization. The administrator must manage GuardDuty for each account in the organization individually.

    When you update the auto-enable setting from ALL or NEW to NONE, this action doesn't disable the corresponding option for your existing accounts. This configuration will apply to the new accounts that join the organization. After you update the auto-enable settings, no new account will have the corresponding option as enabled.

S3Bucket.documentation: Information about the protected S3 bucket resource.

UpdateProtectedResource.documentation: Information about the protected resource that is associated with the created Malware Protection plan. Presently, S3Bucket is the only supported protected resource.

DetectorId.documentation:
The ID of the detector associated with the publishing destinations to update.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

DestinationId.documentation: The ID of the publishing destination to update.

DestinationProperties.documentation: A DestinationProperties object that includes the DestinationArn and KmsKeyArn of the publishing destination.

ObjectPrefixes.documentation: Information about the specified object prefixes. The S3 object will be scanned only if it belongs to any of the specified object prefixes.

UpdateS3BucketResource.documentation: Information about the protected S3 bucket resource.

DetectorId.documentation:
The unique ID of the GuardDuty detector associated with the threat entity set that you want to update.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ThreatEntitySetId.documentation: The ID returned by GuardDuty after updating the threat entity set resource.

Name.documentation:
A user-friendly name to identify the trusted entity set.

The name of your list can include lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, dash (-), and underscore (_).

Location.documentation: The URI of the file that contains the trusted entity set.

The detectorID that specifies the GuardDuty service whose ThreatIntelSet you want to update.

To find the detectorId in the current Region, see the Settings page in the GuardDuty console, or run the ListDetectors API.

ThreatIntelSetId.documentation: The unique ID that specifies the ThreatIntelSet that you want to update.

Activate.documentation: The updated Boolean value that specifies whether the ThreateIntelSet is active or not.

ExpectedBucketOwner.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account ID that owns the Amazon S3 bucket specified in the location parameter.
